userGuide.title: User Guide
userGuide.intro: Welcome to your Quick Shift User Guide! Here you'll find detailed explanations of all the functionalities offered by the platform, helping you make the most of your subscription.
userGuide.outro: Need more help? Contact our support team anytime.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.content: The Dashboard provides a real-time overview of your weekly operations. Key metrics include total staff, scheduled shifts, open shifts that need filling, and staff absences. For Pro and Pro Plus users, it features advanced analytics like hours distribution by role and a cumulative hours analysis, which can be filtered and exported to CSV. This is your command center for making informed decisions.

schedule.title: Schedule Planning
schedule.content: This is the core of Quick Shift. Use the intuitive drag-and-drop calendar to create, assign, and modify shifts. Double-click any day to add a new shift. Drag an existing shift to a new day or assign it to a different employee. Past shifts and clocked-in shifts are automatically locked to prevent accidental changes, ensuring data integrity. Pro Plus users will see real-time clock-in status indicators (Green: present, Yellow: absent, Red: not clocked in) on each shift card.

employees.title: Staff Management
employees.content: The Staff section is your complete employee roster. Add new staff members manually or, with a Pro plan, import them in bulk from a CSV file. Click on any employee to edit their details, including their role, contact information, and profile picture. For Pro Plus users, you can manage and regenerate their unique 6-digit access codes for the mobile app here.

settings.title: Company Settings
settings.content: Customize Quick Shift to fit your business needs. In Settings, you can create and manage Roles (e.g., Manager, Cashier), Locations, and Departments. You can also define custom Absence Types (e.g., Sick Leave, Vacation) and Calendar Events (e.g., Public Holiday, Team Meeting). Setting an event as a 'Holiday' will block shift creation on that day, helping you avoid scheduling errors.
